Title:
Three new species of Boletopsis (Bankeraceae, Thelephorales)
from China
Abstract:
Three new species of Boletopsis, B. macrocarpa, B.
squamosomarginata and B. tibetica, are described and illustrated from
China based on morphology, ecology and phylogenetic analysis by the
internal transcribed spacer regions (ITS) and the large subunit of
nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nLSU). B. macrocarpa is characterized by big
(18 cm in diam) basidiocarps, guttulate basidiospores and growing in
pure forest of Pinus yunnanensis inYunnan Province, Southwest (SW)
China. B. squamosomarginata is characterized by the presence of scales
at pileal margin, stipe with a bulbous base, dentate pores, presence of
cystidioles, and growing in forest of Pinus sylvestris var. mongolica in
Liaoning Province, Northeast (NE) China. B. tibetica is characterized by
smaller pores (3Â–4 per mm), presence of gloeoplerous hyphae in
pileipellis, and growing in forest of XXX in Tibet, SW China.
Phylogenetically the three new species are neither related to each other
nor to the existed species in the genus. Furthermore, main
characteristics of Boletopsis species are listed. A key to accepted
species of Boletopsis is provided.
